definition: to get panicky/to lose one's head/(coll.) (after 得) unbearably/terribly
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: If the truth is the rumours bring fluster , I would tell everybody the right information in time.
sentences.chinese: 是谣言引起的慌乱，我会及时公布真实的信息。

sentences.english: In her panic, Chang`e drank it all up.
sentences.chinese: 嫦娥慌乱中服下了所有的仙丹。

sentences.english: He stood back and just watched as she birthed her baby without fuss or noise.
sentences.chinese: 他往后站，只是看着她生孩子，没有慌乱或吵闹。

sentences.english: Frank jerked a dirty blue handkerchief from his trousers pocket .
sentences.chinese: 富兰克慌乱地从裤兜里拉出一条肮脏的蓝手帕。

sentences.english: RenHui thought of James said, in the mind very panic.
sentences.chinese: 仁惠想到詹姆斯说的话，心里很慌乱。

sentences.english: The honk of horn fluster the driver.
sentences.chinese: 汽车喇叭的响声使司机感到慌乱。

sentences.english: While entering test field, I get up for the fluster, brain one blank.
sentences.chinese: 一进考场，我就慌乱起来，脑子里一片空白。

sentences.english: They ran helter-skelter down the road.
sentences.chinese: 他们沿着公路慌乱地逃走了。

sentences.english: Stolen jewels littered the floor when the robbers fled in a hurry.
sentences.chinese: 抢劫犯在慌乱逃窜时把抢来的珠宝遗撒一地。

sentences.english: He made a small ratchet of panic and that was it.
sentences.chinese: 他只是做了个情急慌乱之下的本能挣扎就放弃了。

sentences.english: Flustered, they escaped to the magic curse Wang Zhigu.
sentences.chinese: 慌乱之中，他们逃入了被魔法诅咒的败王之谷。

sentences.english: That helps handle the fear side of markets.
sentences.chinese: 这有助于遏制市场慌乱的一面。

sentences.english: And the king and Haman sat down to drink; but the city Shushan was perplexed.
sentences.chinese: 王同哈曼坐下饮酒，书珊城的民却都慌乱。

sentences.english: His this ability discovers, entered between personal fluster oneself so female lavatory.
sentences.chinese: 他这才发现，原来自己慌乱间进了女厕。

sentences.english: My cat got in her room and she was real upset and asked me to take it out .
sentences.chinese: 我的猫进了她的房间，她特别慌乱，让我把它弄出去。

sentences.english: The first thing that Cosette felt was a confused and profound melancholy.
sentences.chinese: 珂赛特的最初感受是一种慌乱而沉重的愁苦。

definition: to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
not knowing what to do (idiom); at one's wits' end/embarrassed and at a complete loss
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
